page.title: 02BLAISDON VILLAGE
page.content: {Blaisdon Hall}was built in 1876 by Edwin Crawshay.The next owner of the hall was Peter Stubbs who died in 1904.It is an Elizabethan style hall and over looks some beautiful countryside. All the houses were sold off very cheaply when the estate was sold in 1933, they are all now privately owned.{Blaisdon Hall}is now a school. The church was rebuilt in 1867 and was opened in 1869, costing Â£2000. The tower on the church dates back to the 13th century. The{Red Hart is the only public house in Blaisdon and has been there since 1856. We obtained this information from {Mr Cedric Etherington}who lives in Blaisdon. His hobby is researching the local history of the parish.
